result.execSummary:
The defendant Christine M Hennes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Pay fine plus costs 
*Pay within 60 days or set up payment plan
*Pay restitution in the amount of $1,312.00 to Walmart - paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christine M Hennes

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Statement of Attorney Fee's filed by Atty Jerod Barkley

Defendant Christine M Hennes in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:07 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Barkley makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Pay restititution in the amount of $1,312.00 - defendant's attorney has a receipt showing this has been paid in full; State stipulates to the payment in full.
Pay $50 fine plus costs/surcharges (DNA).
Pay within 60 days or set up a payment plan.
/s/ RJS
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 10, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Pre-trial conference on May 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
P/NG entered.
Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on March 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christine M Hennes in court.  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

1:54 pm. Court calls case.
Court addresses defendant.
Defendant is sworn in by the clerk
Court questions defendant regarding income and 
expenses to determine indigence.

BY THE COURT:
Court grants the defendants petition with the condition that she pays $75 a month for attorneys fees commencing April 1, 2016. Payments will continue until 75% of total cost of amount due is paid.
Adjourned initial appearance at 03-14-2016 01:30 pm
Do not be on the premises of  the Walmart Store in Plover while this matter is pending.
Adjourned initial appearance at 03-14-2016 01:30 pm
Do not be on the premises ofthe Walmart Store in Plover while this matter is pending.

Defendant Christine M Hennes in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

2:36 p.m. Court calls case.

Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.
Defendant is requesting to retain counsel.
Atty Knaapen is requesting a $1,000.00 signature bond with conditions as stated on the record. 

BY THE COURT:  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
